channel.title: New Xbox?
channel.description:
Is Microsoft in the making of a new Xbox?
I Googled "Xbox 720", but some of the hyperlinks looked false.

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
MDIGN:

Hey wait man, you kinda jumped the gun. When I said hardware updates I was referring to drivers and stuff along those lines, like you know how when you get gfx cards and out of the box they are at a low resolution until you update it’s drivers, and how your gfx card can go to a higher resolution than your actual monitor. Sorry if it sounded like I was implying them to build a new Vita with a higher resolution monitor.

But, I am 99.9% sure that they will release a new Vita with the HDMI output that they took out in a newer version as a scheme to get more profits.

Those revisions you keep referring to are known as firmware updates. That’s software, not hardware. Which is exactly what Microsoft keeps doing to their front end on the 360. Thing is, I strongly doubt that the Vita would ever receive a firmware update to increase the display resolution. Plus, if the games are already displaying 720p, there’s no reason to upscale to 1080p just to facilitate having an HDMI cable linking it to a larger monitor, simply because it would look fine as is.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
MDIGN:

But, I am 99.9% sure that they will release a new Vita with the HDMI output that they took out in a newer version as a scheme to get more profits.

This I can see them doing. The PSP is one of the few (the only?) systems that anyone actually added features to that just weren’t available anywhere else, in a hardware revision.

And about the higher res screen, would there be much point on a screen that small?

Maxey:

Sony doesn’t add features in their hardware revisions, they take them out.

Yes. PSP 2000 aside.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
There’d be no point in having the capablity to display a higher resolution than the screen can actually use. It’s wasted potential.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I don’t think it works that way either. I’m sure the Vita’s screen is made at the exact resolution that the video card in it is outputting so I don’t think updating drivers to make it go to a higher resolution would do anything in that circumstance.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
Maxey:

Sony doesn’t add features in their hardware revisions, they take them out.

Yeah lol, I remember when they made the douchebag decision to remove PS2 backwards compatibility from the PS3 and then increased the price.

Also off-topic: Tribes Ascend Beta Key Gamespot has started to give out Tribes beta keys for anyone who wants one, get em’ while their hot.

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

You don’t get how releasing updated products work, do you? They’re not going to release a newer version of the Vita with a higher resolution screen. They don’t want to alienate the people who bought the first version of the Vita. Same fucking reason they won’t increase the RAM in the Xbox 360 or PS3. Stop being an idiot.

Hey wait man, you kinda jumped the gun. When I said hardware updates I was referring to drivers and stuff along those lines, like you know how when you get gfx cards and out of the box they are at a low resolution until you update it’s drivers, and how your gfx card can go to a higher resolution than your actual monitor. Sorry if it sounded like I was implying them to build a new Vita with a higher resolution monitor.

But, I am 99.9% sure that they will release a new Vita with the HDMI output that they took out in a newer version as a scheme to get more profits.

Read full topic

It’s still a dick move, and a lot of people will hate you for it.

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
I’m just pointing out that incrementally improving the performance of your devices is a valid marketing ploy, and that people will still buy your products if you do so.

They don’t want to alienate the people who bought the first version of the Vita. Same fucking reason they won’t increase the RAM in the Xbox 360 or PS3. Stop being an idiot.

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
You don’t get how releasing updated products work, do you? They’re not going to release a newer version of the Vita with a higher resolution screen. They don’t want to alienate the people who bought the first version of the Vita. Same fucking reason they won’t increase the RAM in the Xbox 360 or PS3. Stop being an idiot.

MDIGN:

I think that Nintendo should just quit the console business and just sell the games, their hardware is ‘just now’ catching up to PS3 and Xbox

This may be true, but they’re also making a lot more because their hardware costs less to make, and they’re selling a ton more than Microsoft or Sony. From a business standpoint, they’re doing great, costs are down and profits are up. Why change what works? The only reason Sega got out of the console game is because once people figured out how to burn bootable discs for Dreamcast games, their software sales plummeted, and selling hardware is almost never profitable. Nintendo is selling enough that they don’t need to stop making hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
I do realize this, that’s where hardware updates come into play. (But why would you need a higher rez on a screen that size?) With hardware updates resolution can be increased and so can performance. I kinda see your point, but the resolution doesn’t matter much for now, they decided to cut back on HDMI output and I bet you it’s a part of a scheme that they are going to add it in a PS Vita 3000 or slim or whatever and maybe that’s when they’ll increase resolution.

Edit: Something I found, You may want to look at it. PS Vita Guts

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
The Vita actually runs at 720p but the screen is small enough that you don’t notice the lower level of detail as much as on a big screen.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
You’re not understanding my point. Yes, the games on the Vita look very nice, but they run at a low resolution because it’s not on a huge screen TV.

Sure Battlefield 3 looks amazing, but you can play it on a 4 year old computer if you run it at 320x280.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
Yes, but this can be fixed over time with a few hardware updates. Remember how the Xbox and PS3 game looked at launch, people thought that Prey was as good as it gets and then a few years down the line we have all these other games like Uncharted, Gears, Battlefield, Mass Effect, and ect. that look beautiful and we go back to prey and are like “This was top-notch? The textures are dated and the bump maps look pretty bad”. Well the PS Vita is just launching I have no fear that In a few years the games will run as fast as a PS3 and look as good, with the combined efforts of hardware updates and game optimization everything will be A-ok.

Think of it like this, the PS Vita just needs to be ‘broken-in’.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Except for the part where the Vita isn’t running anything nearly as fast as the PS3. The only reason it can run games that look close to as nice as the PS3 is because they run at a MUCH lower resolution.

Read full topic

item.title: New Xbox?
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
Trigger_Proximity:

Of course they’re fucking making another one. That’s how companies work. They don’t just go HURR DURR WE MAED THING NOW LETS NEVER DO IT AGAIN.

Guaranteed they almost immediately started looking at ways to pack more hardware in a smaller package. So you could say, yeah they’ve been fucking making one for years.

I’m just going to ignore the idiocracy that I have just seen due to your awesome Homestuck avatar.

protip: read other posts first[/SIZE]

Also, they didn’t start working on a new xbox until at least 3 or 4 years after launch, and by working I mean brainstorming, planing, and ect.

I think that Nintendo should just quit the console business and just sell the games, their hardware is ‘just now’ catching up to PS3 and Xbox which are both over 6 years old, and now there’s the PS Vita which is running almost the same hardware as a PS3 but it’s portable. This is very sad Nintendo, their WiiU 's only competition is the PS Vita, a home console v.s. a handheld.

Why is that it’s only competition you ask? Simple, people will buy the Wii U out of the fact that it’s new, just like people buy CoD nowadays. Then, when the new set of Xbox’s and PS3’s come out next year or are revealed this year the WiiU will be decimated and again be stuck with outdated hardware. TBH most people that play Wii is for it’s exclusives like Zelda and Mario, and Mario is starting to bump me the wrong way right about now.

Read full topic

wheybags:

Why? What’s wrong with powerpc?

It’s not really used anymore to my knowledge. I could be wrong though. Intel and AMD make up the majority of the processor share. The only computers I’ve ever used that had PowerPC processors were the Macs in my high school.
